options.content:
# Thoth PostgreSQL metrics Grafana Dashboard

This dashboard contains all the operational metrics focused on the PostgreSQL database, from real time metrics to pg dumps stored by cronjobs on the Ceph Bucket.

## Variables

The variables you can change are described below. For specific overlays they are clustered togheter and you need to set them all to see all metrics belonging to that overlay.

### moc/smaug

- *cluster*: `moc/smaug`
- *instance*: `postgres-metrics-exporter-thoth-graph-prod.apps.smaug.na.operate-first.cloud`
- *metrics_exporter_instance*: `metrics-exporter-thoth-infra-prod.apps.smaug.na.operate-first.cloud`

panels.description: Sets the maximum number of concurrent connections.
panels.title: Max Connections

panels.description: Sets the number of shared memory buffers used by the server. [Units converted to bytes.]
panels.title: Shared Buffers

panels.description: Sets the plannerâ€™s assumption about the size of the data cache. [Units converted to bytes.]
panels.title: Effective Cache

panels.description: Sets the maximum memory to be used for maintenance operations. [Units converted to bytes.]
panels.title: Maintenance Work Mem

panels.description: Sets the maximum memory to be used for query workspaces. [Units converted to bytes.]
panels.title: Work Mem

panels.description: Sets the WAL size that triggers a checkpoint. [Units converted to bytes.]
panels.title: Max WAL Size

panels.description: Sets the plannerâ€™s estimate of the cost of a nonsequentially fetched disk page.
panels.title: Random Page Cost

panels.description: Sets the plannerâ€™s estimate of the cost of a sequentially fetched disk page.
panels.title: Seq Page Cost

panels.description: Maximum number of concurrent worker processes.
panels.title: Max Worker Processes

panels.description: Sets the maximum number of parallel processes per executor node.
panels.title: Max Parallel Workers

targets.expr: pg_stat_database_blks_hit{field="$instance", datname="thoth", cluster="$cluster"} / (pg_stat_database_blks_read{field="$instance", datname="thoth", cluster="$cluster"} + pg_stat_database_blks_hit{field="$instance", datname="thoth", cluster="$cluster"})

panels.description: Total amount of data written to temporary files by queries in this database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created, and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.
panels.title: Temp File

panels.description:
pg_stat_bgwriter_buffers_alloc (cumulative)
Number of buffers allocated, 

pg_stat_bgwriter_buffers_backend (cumulative)
Number of buffers written directly by a backend, 

pg_stat_bgwriter_buffers_backend_fsync (cumulative)
Number of times a backend had to execute its own fsync call (normally the background writer handles those even when the backend does its own write),

pg_stat_bgwriter_buffers_checkpoint (cumulative)
Number of buffers written during checkpoints,

pg_stat_bgwriter_buffers_clean (cumulative)
Number of buffers written by the background writer
panels.title: Buffers (bgwriter)

panels.description:
pg_stat_bgwriter_checkpoint_sync_time (cumulative)
Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are synchronized to disk, in milliseconds,

pg_stat_bgwriter_checkpoint_write_time (cumulative)
Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are written to disk, in milliseconds
panels.title: Checkpoint Stats
Last graph backup dump [0 saved, 1 -> missed, alarm required]
Number of dumps available on Ceph
pg dumps not cleaned [0 empty, 1 -> to be cleaned, alarm required]
